head.title: Shock Waves From the Mideast, on Two Fronts

hedline.hl1: Shock Waves From the Mideast, on Two Fronts

abstract.p: Golda Fleischman letter says Palestinian violence should prompt Israel to re-evaluate its policy toward Arabs (S)

block.p: The horrible deaths of the two Israeli soldiers in Ramallah (front page, Oct. 13) should serve as a lesson to Israel that the violence it has shown to the Palestinians and Arab Israelis in the past only serves to further the Middle East conflict and thus harms Israel itself. Children seeing fathers humiliated by the Israeli Army become outraged, and these feelings find expression in outbursts like the ones taking place.

The horrible deaths of the two Israeli soldiers in Ramallah (front page, Oct. 13) should serve as a lesson to Israel that the violence it has shown to the Palestinians and Arab Israelis in the past only serves to further the Middle East conflict and thus harms Israel itself. Children seeing fathers humiliated by the Israeli Army become outraged, and these feelings find expression in outbursts like the ones taking place.

In the wake of the recent clashes, Israel needs to re-evaluate its policy toward the Arabs. Prime Minister Ehud Barak should not react with further violence. It is time for the government to learn from its past mistakes.
